docs.snippet: Punishing Russia for election interference is not a partisan issue.

headline.main: While Putin Meddles, Trump Congratulates Him

docs.snippet: Readers react to the president’s latest salvos on immigration and business.

docs.snippet: After a dozen years, Vanessa Haydon Trump says she is leaving the first family.

headline.print_headline: A Trump  Is Exiting  The Family
headline.main: Unbecoming a Trump: The Vanessa Trump Divorce

docs.snippet: The president argued that the conversation in which he congratulated President Vladimir V. Putin could help relations with Russia and, in turn, national security interests.

headline.print_headline: Trump Says He Fostered Relations In Putin Call
headline.main: Trump, Defending Call With Putin, Attacks ‘Crazed’ Media and His Predecessors

docs.snippet: After sixty-one weeks in the White House, President Trump has found someone he won’t attack on Twitter: Stormy Daniels.

headline.print_headline: Trump Privately Rails Against a Porn Actress. On Twitter? Silence.
headline.main: Trump Can’t Stop Tweeting, but Goes Silent on Stormy Daniels

docs.snippet: In the wake of Andrew McCabe’s firing, and the president’s gloating tweets, Republicans once again could take action to protect democracy — but they refuse.

headline.main: The Wrong People Are Criticizing Donald Trump

docs.snippet: As diplomats pack their bags, some senior American officials are pressing for a more aggressive approach, but President Trump remains unconvinced.

headline.print_headline: Trump Is Urged To Get Tougher On Russia Policy
headline.main: Trump Advisers Urge Tougher Russia Policy After Expulsions

docs.snippet: The Times, in a statement issued by its communications department, said, “We stand by our reporting, which was confirmed by multiple people close to the president.”

docs.snippet: The president stunned lawmakers with calls for gun control. Also, Hope Hicks, the White House communications director, is to step down.

headline.main: Listen to ‘The Daily’: Trump vs. the N.R.A.

docs.snippet: The dispute over the Trump hotel in Panama City took another turn. It has a new name and competing websites. But only one has rooms available.

headline.print_headline: One Hotel in Panama, but Two Competing Websites (and a Single Mention of Trump)
